alert.note: Alert for Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 10:39PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following counties, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc and Waldo. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockland, Camden, Damariscotta, Lincolnville, Wiscasset, Bristol, Bremen, Warren, Thomaston, and Rockport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
